text:
Roger Federer
Inspiration
5 years, 10 years 15 years from now,

you know obviously at
some point you will hang up your racket,

how would Roger Federer
like to be remembered?
I don’t know; as a good tennis player

and a guy who’s able to
help the sport and help others.

I’m sure I will have more time
for my foundation,
and in the continent of Africa

which is very close to
my heart because of my mum.

I’m actually very
excited about my life after tennis,
not that I want to run into it at all
but I still hope that I’m also in tennis

in some shape or form just because
it’s this great game that has given me

all these opportunities and,
if that’s maybe helping juniors
in the future in Switzerland or
whatever that may be you know

I’m really actually excited to see
what’s going to come my way
in sort of 10-15, 20 years time.
Has Rolex inspired you in life,
in your attitude, in your performance?

I’m very proud to be associated with
Rolex, it's in a way a dream come true.
It’s nice working closely with them,
being such a good friend, almost a family
really together and

it’s nice to be linked to
a Swiss brand that is so international

and does things
in such a great way in terms of quality.

I think it’s wonderful
how they have so many ambassadors

from so many different countries,
they have different sports
they support such as Equestrian or Sailing,
or Golf or Tennis
and I try to enhance the brand as well

with what I can give
from the sporting side.
When you go to the headquarters

and you see the watchmakers
working extremely precise,

everything they touch
and do is through the perfection

and making the brand
the best possible brand in the world,

such things drive you
as well to excellency so

yeah I’ve been inspired by
Rolex for sure.
Another Rolex Rendezvous
